Room.Name: Front Entry of the Great Library
Room.ShortDescription: You are in the magnificent front foyer of the equally spectacular Great Library, built primarily to house the world's greatest works.
Room.LongDescription: The great entry is surrounded with mirrors and glass, with a large sun- roof letting the brilliant sunlight illuminate the Library. There are a number of fantastic displays for everyone to see and experiment with. There are three doors here. The oak door leads to an "Archives" room. The green door to the north says "Research" on a old and tarnished bronze plaque. The blue door to the west says "Reference" on it's plaque.
